ref: 9239 bidala n.(?) ʻ a half ʼ (in bidala -- saṁhita -- ʻ composed of halves ʼ AitBr., bidala -- kārīˊ -- f. ʻ woman who splits bamboos ʼ VS.), vidala -- 1 n. ʻ split bamboo ʼ Mn. (vēṇu -- vidala<-> Gaut.), ʻ split pea ʼ Suśr. (masūra -- vi˚ Rājat.). [Despite EWA ii 430 to be separated from vidalati ʻ rends ʼ R. (vidala -- 2 m. W., ˚lana -- n. Kāv., ˚lita -- Gīt., vidara -- m. lex.) to the influence of which, however, it prob. owes its form with v -- . Other contaminated forms: -- vidalīkr̥ta -- MBh. ʻ rent ʼ < ʻ *split in two ʼ (cf. dvividalīkr̥ta<-> Hariv.) and (via dvidala -- ʻ forked ʼ Hariv. hypersanskritism for bidala -- ) veṇudala -- n. ʻ a split bamboo ʼ Mn., dala -- n. ʻ half ʼ VarBr̥S. Conn. bindati (and bilati, bēlayati, vēl˚?) ʻ splits ʼ Dhātup.? (J. C. W.)]
Pa. bidala -- n. ʻ split -- bamboo, split pea ʼ; O
Si. biyalla (st. ˚yali -- ) ʻ division of a seed, seedglobe ʼ. --
Pk. vidala -- n. ʻ bamboo, split dried rice ʼ (vidalida -- ʻ crushed ʼ);
A. biyalī -- māh ʻ husked pulse with ghee ʼ;
B. biuli ʻ split and unhusked pulse ready for cooking ʼ.
